prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis. [info] Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As I said earlier, I was assigned to guard duty in the Allebahstian Embassy.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: After I saw the Steel Samurai off on his way towards the ambassador's office...
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I returned to the rose garden for a bit, and checked up on the security situation.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: After all the preparations were in place, I was called back by Ambassador Alba to his office.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: When I arrived, Ambassador Alba was watering the flowers on the windowsill.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 5
Testimony: There were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. So, I have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The goal is to find a pair where one piece of evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

First, I'll need to go through the testimonies and see what each one says. Then, I'll check the evidence to see if any of them provide information that would contradict the testimony.

Looking at the testimonies, I see that Testimony 5 says that there were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box. Now, I need to look for any evidence that relates to passionflowers. 

Looking through the evidences, I find Evidence 14: Passionflowers. It mentions that there were two large flowers in bloom with vines supported by stakes and still growing. This seems to directly contradict Testimony 5, which states there were four passionflowers.

Wait, but Testimony 5 says four, and Evidence 14 says two. That's a contradiction because they can't both be true. So, the evidence and testimony in question are Evidence 14 and Testimony 5.

I think that's the pair. Evidence 14 states there were two passionflowers, while Testimony 5 claims there were four. This inconsistency suggests a contradiction between the two pieces of information.
</think>

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: So Babahl's statue was draped in the Yatagarasu's clothes, and then shot over here?
Person: Lang
Testimony 1
Testimony: Even if you fired the arrows from this side, they wouldn't go far with a statue tied to them!
Person: Lang
Testimony 2
Testimony: If it wasn't a statue that was tied to the arrows, then what did the crossbow launch...?
Person: Lang
Testimony 3
Testimony: I don't think I need to tell you that the Primidux Statue didn't sprout wings.

Testimony 4

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which piece of evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the evidence and testimonies one by one to see where there might be a conflict.

First, looking at the testimonies, I see that Testimony 0 says, "So Babahl's statue was draped in the Yatagarasu's clothes, and then shot over here?" This suggests that the Yatagarasu's clothes were used to cover the Babahl statue before it was fired over to Allebahst. Testimony 1 adds, "Even if you fired the arrows from this side, they wouldn't go far with a statue tied to them!" This implies that the statue was tied to the crossbow arrows, which doesn't make much sense because statues are heavy and wouldn't be easily moved by arrows.

Testimony 2 follows up with, "If it wasn't a statue that was tied to the arrows, then what did the crossbow launch...?" This seems to question whether the crossbow actually launched a statue, which is physically impossible. Finally, Testimony 3 says, "I don't think I need to tell you that the Primidux Statue didn't sprout wings," which suggests that the statue wasn't capable of moving on its own, further supporting the idea that it was tied or moved somehow.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 16 mentions that the Primidux Statue was swapped with a fake one and was used as a weapon. This aligns with the testimonies because it suggests that the statue was involved in the attack, possibly being moved or used in some way. However, Evidence 30 talks about crossbow arrows that were actually hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern, which contradicts the testimonies about the statue being tied to arrows because the evidence shows the arrows were something else entirely.

So, putting it all together, Testimony 0-4 suggest that the statue was tied to arrows and moved, but Evidence 30 shows that the arrows were actually hair sticks, not part of the crossbow attack as described in the testimonies. This means there's a contradiction between the testimonies and the evidence regarding the crossbow arrows and the Primidux Statue.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's see, the characters involved are Kay Faraday, her father Byrne Faraday who was killed, Calisto Yew who killed him, and others like Dick Gumshoe, Shi-Long Lang, Franziska von Karma, and Ambassadors Colias Palaeno and Quercus Alba. There's also a smuggling ring involved and some other suspects like Larry Butz and Tyrell Badd.

Looking at the evidences, there's a lot about the embassy, the Primidux statue, some fires in Babahl, and a pushcart with blood inside. The testimonies involve people like Lang and Alba giving their accounts of what happened.

I think the key is to find a piece of evidence that directly contradicts what someone is saying. For example, if someone claims they didn't do something, but evidence shows they did. Or if the evidence supports one version of events while the testimony contradicts it.

Wait, in the previous examples, they found that Evidence 30 (Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows) contradicted Testimony 0 from Lang. Maybe I should look for something similar here.

Let me check Evidence 30 again. It says that the hair sticks are actually crossbow arrows from Allebahst, used in the murder. But in Testimony 0, Lang says he doesn't understand why he's being suspected, implying maybe he's innocent or has an alibi.

If the evidence shows that the crossbow arrows were used in the murder, and the testimony suggests Lang didn't do it, that's a contradiction. Or maybe the evidence supports that someone else did it, contradicting Lang's testimony.

Alternatively, maybe another evidence contradicts a testimony. For example, Evidence 37 about the pushcart with blood inside, and someone's testimony about their alibi.

Wait, in the previous answer, Evidence 30 and Testimony 0 were the pair. So maybe that's the case here too. Or perhaps a different pair.

I need to carefully read each evidence and testimony to spot the contradiction. Let's go through them one by one.

Starting with Testimony 0 from Alba: He says he still doesn't understand why he's being suspected and that he was in Allebahst the whole time, providing an alibi. If the evidence shows that the crossbow arrows used in the murder are from Allebahst, and if Lang was in Babahl, then maybe the arrows were used by someone else, contradicting Lang's testimony.

Or perhaps the evidence about the pushcart shows that someone else was involved, contradicting Alba's testimony.

I'm getting a bit confused. Maybe I should focus on the key points. The evidence about the crossbow arrows being from Allebahst supports that Lang, who's from Babahl, didn't use them. So if Lang says he didn't do it, but the evidence shows that someone from Allebahst did, that could be a contradiction.

Alternatively, the evidence about the pushcart having blood inside, and the testimony about alibis. If the pushcart was used in the murder, and the person who pushed it had an alibi, that might be a contradiction.

I think I need to look for a direct contradiction between one piece of evidence and one testimony. Maybe Evidence 30 (crossbow arrows from Allebahst) contradicts Testimony 0 from Lang, who's from Babahl, implying he couldn't have used them. So the evidence supports that someone else, not Lang, used the arrows, contradicting his testimony.

Or perhaps Evidence 37 (pushcart with blood) and Testimony 4 from Alba, who claims he was in Allebahst the whole time, providing an alibi. If the pushcart was used to move the body, and the blood inside suggests it was involved, then Alba's alibi might be compromised if the pushcart was used in the murder while he was supposedly in Allebahst.

I think the key pair is Evidence 30 and Testimony 0, similar to the previous answer. Or maybe another pair like Evidence 37 and Testimony 4.

After considering, I think Evidence 30 (Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows) and Testimony 0 (Lang's statement) contradict each other because the evidence shows the crossbow arrows were from Allebahst, supporting that Lang, being from Babahl, couldn't have used them, thus contradicting his testimony that he's innocent or has an alibi.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. So, we have a bunch of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find one pair that directly contradict each other.

First, I'll start by going through the testimonies because they seem to be from the same person, probably Ambassador Alba. Let's see what they're saying.

Testimony 0: "I killed Mr. Coachen in this theater using a knife that was stuck in my bouquet?"
Okay, so Alba is claiming that he killed Coachen with a knife that was in his bouquet. That's a direct statement.

Testimony 1: "I left that bouquet in the theater! Anyone could've taken the knife from there!"

Here, Alba is saying that the bouquet was left in the theater, implying someone else took the knife from there. But wait, in the previous testimony, he said he used the knife from the bouquet to kill Coachen. So, if he left the bouquet in the theater, how did he get the knife from it? That seems contradictory.

Testimony 2: "Besides, Mr. Coachen's body was discovered in Babahl, right?"

Alba is pointing out that the body was found in Babahl, which makes sense because the murder happened there.

Testimony 3: "There is no way for me to have transported his body from the theater to Babahl!"

Again, Alba is denying that he transported the body from the theater to Babahl, which aligns with the fact that the body was found in Babahl. But this doesn't directly contradict the previous testimonies.

So, focusing on Testimony 0 and Testimony 1, it seems like a contradiction. If Alba used a knife from his bouquet to kill Coachen, then he shouldn't have left the bouquet in the theater unless he took the knife out first. But the way he phrased it in Testimony 1 suggests that the knife was left in the bouquet, which was in the theater, implying someone else took it. This creates a conflict because he can't both use the knife and leave it in the theater unless he took it out, which he's not claiming.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 5 mentions the knife found at the scene, matching the wound. If Alba used his own knife from the bouquet, then the evidence would support that. However, if the knife was left in the theater, and someone else took it, that would contradict Alba's claim in Testimony 0.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 0 and Testimony 1, where Alba claims to have used a knife from his bouquet but also says the bouquet was left in the theater, implying the knife was there for someone else to take.

So, the evidence that supports this is Evidence 5, which is the knife matching the wound, and Testimony 0 and 1, which create the contradiction.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the information provided carefully.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Kay Faraday, who is a young girl claiming to be the 2nd Yatagarasu and is on the trail of her father's killer. Her father, Byrne Faraday, was a prosecutor who was killed seven years ago by Calisto Yew. Calisto Yew killed Byrne and then escaped, claiming to be the Yatagarasu and making Kay his escape route.

Then there's Dick Gumshoe, a homicide detective in charge of the initial investigation. Shih-na is Lang's secretary, supporting him in his investigations. Franziska von Karma is cooperating with Interpol on a smuggling case. Colias Palaeno is the Ambassador of Babahl, who is very protective of his country's tourism industry. Manny Coachen is the victim, who worked for Palaeno as his secretary and was a good man. Shi-Long Lang is after the smuggling ring and claims to have the highest arrest rate. Quercus Alba is the Ambassador of Allebahst, a retired army man, and he's quite harsh. Larry Butz is the man behind the Steel Samurai mask, a friend from grade school. Tyrell Badd is an eagle-eyed homicide detective whose partner was killed seven years ago, and he's here after Calisto Yew. Mask☆DeMasque II is an opportunist found in Allebahst, and the Ex-Security Lady is Wendy Oldbag, the real name behind the Pink Princess mask.

Now, looking at the evidences, there are 37 pieces of evidence, each with a name and description. The testimonies are from different characters, mostly Alba and Lang, discussing their roles and testimonies about the events.

The task is to find one pair where evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to find one evidence that directly contradicts a testimony.

Starting with the testimonies, let's look at Testimony 0 from Alba: "I watched from the last row. The stage was well-lit, but it was dark out in the audience." This seems to suggest that Alba was in the audience during the event and saw it happen.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 2 is "Steel Samurai's Autograph," which is an autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon. This suggests that the Steel Samurai was present and signed something, possibly at the scene of the crime.

If Alba was in the audience, he wouldn't have been able to get an autograph from the Steel Samurai, as they would have been on stage. Therefore, the testimony that he was in the audience watching the show contradicts the evidence that he obtained an autograph from the Steel Samurai, implying he was present at the scene.

So, the evidence "Steel Samurai's Autograph" (Evidence 2) and the testimony "I watched from the last row" (Testimony 0) contradict each other because they provide conflicting information about Alba's presence at the scene.

I think this is a solid pair because the testimony suggests Alba was an audience member, while the evidence indicates he was interacting with the Steel Samurai, which wouldn't have happened if he was just watching from the audience.
